metadata.title: CVE-2018-12326 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in redis-cli of Redis before 4.0.10 and 5.x before 5.0 RC3allows an attacker to achieve code execution and escalate to higherprivileges via a crafted command line. NOTE: It is unclear whether thereare any common situations in which redis-cli is used with, for example, a-h (aka hostname) argument from an untrusted source.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.1
redis-sentinel - 5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.1
redis-server - 5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.1
redis-tools - 5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redis package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.1').
